title: Calculus
description: Calculus is a branch of mathematics that deals with continuous change and motion. It encompasses two main branches: differential calculus and integral calculus. Differential calculus focuses on the concept of derivatives, which measures the rate of change of a function at a given point. Integral calculus, on the other hand, deals with the concept of integrals, which calculates the accumulation of quantities over a given interval.

steps.title: Learn the basics
steps.description: Start by understanding the fundamental concepts of calculus, including limits, derivatives, and integrals. These concepts form the foundation of calculus and are crucial for further learning.

topics.name: Limits
topics.description: Limits are used to define the behavior of a function as it approaches a certain value or infinity. They are fundamental to understanding continuity, differentiability, and integrability.

topics.name: Derivatives
topics.description: Derivatives measure the rate of change of a function at a given point. They are used to calculate slopes of tangent lines, determine critical points, and analyze the behavior of functions.

topics.name: Integrals
topics.description: Integrals calculate the accumulation of quantities over a given interval. They are used to find areas under curves, calculate total displacement, and solve various real-world problems.

steps.title: Advanced Calculus
steps.description: Once you have a solid understanding of the basics, you can delve into advanced topics in calculus. These topics include applications of derivatives and integrals, multivariable calculus, differential equations, and more.

topics.name: Applications of Calculus
topics.description: Explore how calculus is applied in various fields such as physics, engineering, economics, and biology. Learn how to model and solve real-world problems using calculus techniques.

topics.name: Multivariable Calculus
topics.description: Extend your calculus knowledge to functions with multiple variables. Learn about partial derivatives, multiple integrals, and vector calculus.

topics.name: Differential Equations
topics.description: Study equations that involve derivatives and their applications. Learn how to solve ordinary differential equations and understand their role in modeling dynamic systems.
